pageContext.claim: “Happy Labor Day! Our country is doing better than ever before with unemployment setting record lows. The U.S. has tremendous upside potential as we go about fixing some of the worst Trade Deals ever made by any country in the world. Big progress being made!”
pageContext.analysis: The unemployment rate is 3.9 percent, which is not a record. It hit 3.9 percent near the end of Bill Clinton's presidency and dipped to as low as 2.5 percent in 1953 under President Dwight Eisenhower.  In fact, the unemployment rate was below 3.9 percent every month between January, 1951 and November, 1953  -- a period of almost two years.
